title: Puttles Bridge Walking Route

images.title: Jim Champion / Aldridgehill Inclosure, New Forest
images.caption: Aldridgehill Inclosure, New Forest. This varied inclosure has much open mature oak and beech along with some sweet chestnut and blocks of conifer. This photo shows a typical view in the southwest corner of the inclosure, a short walk north of the Puttles Bridge car park.

images.title: Trish Steel, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Woodland walk. The woodland path is gravelled at the start of the walk as it leaves the car park at Puttles Bridge.

images.title: Jim Champion / Path to the bridge across Ober Water, New Forest
images.caption: Path to the bridge across Ober Water. The trees at the end of this path are part of the riverine woodland alongside Ober Water, to the south of Clumber Inclosure. The path leads down from Holm Hill.

images.title: Trish Steel, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View of Ober Water near to the Puttles Bridge car park.

images.title: Chris Downer / Rhinefield: reflection of Rhinefield House
images.caption: Rhinefield, reflection of Rhinefield House. The south front, reflected in the ornamental pond in front of it. It's a splendid hotel set in a former manor house in the heart of the New Forest. The main entrances are around the less sunny north side.

images.title: Chris Downer / Rhinefield: fruit trees
images.caption: Rhinefield: fruit trees. A small avenue of trees starts to show the signs of autumn

images.title: Chris Downer / Rhinefield: fountain and autumnal tree
images.caption: Rhinefield, fountain and autumnal tree. A pleasant scene in the grounds of the house.

description: This walk starts from the Puttles Bridge car park near Brockenhurst in the New Forest. The car park is a popular place for starting a walk with nice trails along Ober Water and around the adjacent Aldridgehill Inclosure. This circular walk also takes you up to the nearby Rhinefield House, a fine hotel set in a former manor house. The walk starts from the car park on the Rhinefield Road, just to the west of Brockenhurst. From here you can pick up footpaths heading east along the pretty Ober Water. The route then turns around to pass through the woodland trails in the Aldridgehill Inclosure and the Clumber Inclosure before coming to Rhinefield House. This old manor house is now a hotel surrounded by beautiful grounds which include ornamental ponds, gardens and a fountain. You can stop here for afternoon tea in the Conservatory or on the outdoor terrace where there are wonderful views to the pond. Afterwards you can enjoy a stroll around the delightful grounds. After exploring the hotel you can head south to return to the car park where the walk finishes.
